title.rendered: NFR Live Stream 2023 – How to Watch Las Vegas NFR Online

content.rendered:
NFR is Back! Las Vegas will be welcoming the National Finals Rodeo (NFR) this year in December for a 10-day event. The city has been the home of the NFR for more than 30 years. The National Finals Rodeo is taking place in Thomas & Mack Center from December 7-16 and there will be rodeo events every single night.

Watch NFR 2023 Live Online - SUBSCRIBE HERE

NFR 2023 Streaming info
Streaming
The Cowboy Channel (real-time) Watch Here
RFD-TV (real-time) Watch Here
Cowboy Channel Plus (International) Watch Here

 

The 2023 National Finals Rodeo will be an incredible experience for rodeo fans all over the United States. The NFR is shaping up to be one of the most competitive and entertaining rodeos that the world has ever seen. The top cowboys in the world will be putting their boots on and taking each other on to try and claim a world championship in their respective events. Mark your calendars and make sure you do not miss out on a single second of action this December.

2016 NPC GREATER NAPLES CLASSIC BODYBUILDING, FIGURE, BIKINI PHYSIQUE · PDF file 2016-08-02 · In consideration of being allowed to participate in any way in the NPC Greater Naples buy steroids bodybuilding motivation – it´s not about steroids hd [archive] – brotherhoodofpain.com

The season-ending rodeo championship is one of the sport’s premier events including Bareback Riding, Steer Wrestling, Team Roping, Saddle Bronc Riding, Tie-Down Roping, Barrel Racing, and Bull Riding. The Cowboy Channel (TCC) will air the 10-day NFR live streaming from Thomas & Mack Center in Las Vegas.

National Finals Rodeo 2023
Venue Thomas & Mack Center, Las Vegas
Start Date Thursday, December 7
End Date Saturday, December 16
Time 8:45 p.m. to 11:30 p.m. ET
Broadcast The Cowboy Channel
Live Stream Watch Here

So, don’t miss a single moment of the NFR LIVE action. Don’t worry, If you can’t attend in Las Vegas NFR, we’ll discuss here how to watch NFR 2023 live streaming online real-time TV coverage.

What time does the NFR start?

The Wrangler NFR performances will officially start at 8:45 PM each night and typically goes until 11:30 PM (ET). For individuals who plan on attending the National Finals Rodeo festivities in Las Vegas, there are a variety of sponsored activities to get involved with during the 10-day period between 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM (PT). See the complete NFR schedule page.

Where will the Vegas NFR be held?

All of the NFR performances will take place at the Thomas & Mack Center in Las Vegas. Normally home ballpark of the Las Vegas Rangers of MLB, this venue can seat up to 40,300 people and is consistently sold out for the NFR.

What Channel is the NFR be on?

The Cowboy Channel will broadcast the entire NFR 2023 performances from 7-16 December beginning at 8:45 PM (ET) every night. This is an exclusive multi-year agreement between the Rural Media Group (RMG) and the PRCA which will see the Wrangler NFR move to The Cowboy Channel (TCC) and RFD-TV. The National Finals Rodeo will not be shown on any other TV network during the 10-day period. Catch NFR 2023 live-action online channels.

How to watch NFR Live Stream 2023 Online

The Cowboy Channel will broadcast full 10-day performances live and simulcast on RFD-TV. In 2023, The Cowboy Channel (TCC) and RFD-TV began airing the National Finals Rodeo live streams. Additionally, you can watch live or on-demand performances of the NFR via the PRCA on Cowboy Channel Plus app.

If one is unable to watch 2023 NFR live via TV, streaming could be a viable option instead. The Cowboy Channel, RFD-TV, and PRCA on Cowboy Channel Plus will cover 10 days and nights performances concurrently live or on-demand. The 10-day event includes the Pro Rodeo League of Women Style Show and Luncheon, Benny Binion’s World Famous Wrangler NFR Bucking Horse Sale, the PRCA Awards Banquet & Gala, and Buckle Presentations at night.

The Cowboys Channel

Millions of TV viewers will now have the chance to see the ultimate rodeo live on two national networks simultaneously. In addition, the new partnership includes a wide variety of other PRCA programming, including their Xtreme Bulls and PRO RODEO Tour, thus expanding their availability and coverage of PRCA PRO RODEO events on The Cowboy Channel dramatically. Now, you can watch The Cowboy Channel on Direct TV 603, Dish Network 232, and Cox 260 from anywhere at any time.

You can enjoy The Cowboy Channel here:

  • AT&T (Channel 566)
  • Charter Spectrum
  • Comcast
  • Cox
  • DirecTV (channel 603)
  • DISH (Channel 232)
  • Mediacom
  • Suddenlink
  • Sling TV’s Heartland Package
  • Verizon FiOS TV

To find out if RFD-TV and THE COWBOY CHANNEL are available in your area, click here and please enter your zip code and choose your Pay TV provider.

RFD-TV Now

It costs $9.99 per month or $89.99 per year. In addition to NFR 2023 LIVE, RFD-TV Now provides an extensive library of on-demand content. You can access more than 90 shows such as The Best of Marty Stuart, Opry Encore, Hee Haw, FarmHer, and Ag PHD. You can also catch daily broadcasts of Market Day Report and Rural Evening News. Roku players, Roku TVs, and Amazon’s Fire TV are all included in the lineup of streaming players and devices for RFD-TV Now.

You can enjoy RFD-TV on these platforms:

  • AT&T (Channel 568 & 1568)
  • Charter Spectrum
  • Comcast
  • Cox
  • DIRECTV (Channel 345)
  • DIRECTV NOW: click here
  • DISH (Channel 231)
  • Mediacom
  • Sling TV’s Heartland Package
  • Suddenlink

The RFD-TV is also available on RFD-TV Now, Android TV, Apple TV, Fire TV, Roku & Samsung TV

PRCA on The Cowboy Channel+ App

In addition to providing Wrangler NFR live-streamed and on-demand PRCA rodeo events across the country, the PRCA on The Cowboy Channel+ App will maintain fans’ familiarity with their favorite PRCA rodeos and athletes. You can access the content through any browser, smart TV, or device, as well as through a mobile app (available for Android and iOS).

You’ll have access to up-to-date news, bios, rodeo highlights, and more for free. Subscribers will have access to premium content such as six simultaneous live rodeo feeds, The Cowboy Channel’s video-on-demand library, classic PRCA archives, and the only place to watch the 2023 National Finals Rodeo (NFR).

For just $9.99 a month, you can subscribe to The Cowboy Channel+ or save up to 25% when you sign up for the whole year plan priced at $89.99. Get PRCA on The Cowboy Channel+ app here www.cowboychannelplus.com

Streaming National Finals Rodeo Using a VPN

Some countries will not allow the viewing of certain websites and can block them based on the location gathered from an individual’s IP address. In these situations, a reliable and encrypted VPN (Virtual Private Network) can prove to be helpful. A VPN will allow an individual to remotely connect to a server located in a different country that allows the desired website viewing to take place. The following VPNs can prove to be very useful:

ExpressVPN

This source offers a selection of servers that spans over 90 countries. Currently, they offer monthly ($12.95/month), semi-annual ($59.95/6-months), and annual ($99.95) plans. Included with each plan is the offer of 30-day money-back guarantee in the event that a user is dissatisfied.

IPVanish

The offering from this source includes servers that span over 60 countries. The current subscription plans consist of monthly ($10/month), quarterly ($26.99/3-months), and annual ($77.99/year) options. Included with each plan is the offer of a 7-day money-back guarantee in the event that a user is dissatisfied.

NordVPN

While maintaining a selection of servers that spans over 60 countries, this VPN source currently has subscription plans that consist of monthly ($11.95/month), semi-annual ($54/6-months), annual ($83.88/year), and bi-annual ($95.75/2-years) options.

NFR Live Stream Free Services

While there are no “official” ways to watch the NFR live stream for free without cable, there are several ways that one could go about still tapping into other resources to create a temporary viewing experience without incurring an extra cost. While it may take some combination of luck and signing up for particular services close to the time of the event just to cancel them shortly after, the efforts can still be made nonetheless. The following are some platforms where these strategies could be useful:

Stream NFR Live on DirecTV Now

Allows for the viewing of over 65 live channels at $40/month. In order to take advantage of the free possibilities, one would have to sign up and receive the free 7-day trial. If timed properly, one could watch the majority of the NFR during the free trial period and cancel free of charge prior to the trial’s expiration.

Watch NFR Live Online Free on Sling TV

NFR fans will be able to watch the iconic rodeo event on Sling TV. The Cowboy Channel will also be streamed on Sling TV via Heartland Extra package. If you are a subscriber of Sling TV’s Heartland Extra package then you can access the Wrangler NFR 2023 live.

NFR 2023 Live Stream on Hulu TV

Allows for the viewing of over 50 live channels at $39.99/month. In order to take advantage of the free possibilities, one would have to sign up and receive the free 7-day trial. Once the trial is up, one could cancel the service free of charge.

Access NFR live on YouTube TV

Allows for the viewing of over 50 live channels at $40/month. In order to take advantage of the free possibilities, one would have to sign up and receive the free 7-day trial. Once the trial is up, one could cancel the service free of charge.

NFR Live Streaming on PlayStation Vue

Allows for the viewing of over 75 channels at $49.99/month. In order to take advantage of the free possibilities, one would have to sign up and receive the free 5-day trial. Once the trial is up, one could cancel the service free of charge.

NFR LIVE on The Cowboy Channel

The prestigious rodeo will be available on various Rodeo Channels. The Cowboy Channel is the only official broadcast partner for the Wrangler NFR streaming. PRCA and Rural Media Group recently made a new deal about NFR live broadcast with The Cowboy Channel & simultaneously on RFD-TV. Moreover, fans can also stream their loving NFR live stream on NFRPass.Com in both HD & SD at a cheaper rate than any other media.

How you can Tune In NFR 2023

You can watch the Wrangler NFR live stream on The Cowboy Channel Plus. You can also watch the rodeo on The Cowboy Channel as well. Make sure that you watch every single night from December 1st to December 10th as you will not want to miss any of the incredible cowboys. With 6 exciting events happening every night, there is something for every fan. Check out the NFR schedule and get everyday information.

NFR Live Streaming on Social Media

One increasingly popular method of viewing live events comes in the form of social media viewing. The way this typically works is through an individual using their mobile device to live stream the event to a social media platform of their choosing. The most popular platforms for this method are as follows:

YouTube

The most popular video-sharing site on the planet has historically built its name upon uploaded videos. However, the site now allows live-streaming capabilities, making it perfect for free viewing of live events such as NFR, as long as a streaming user can be found.

Facebook

Various individual accounts or pages are bound to be streaming the NFR live events. Interested individuals will have to search for these opportunities throughout the platform as it gets closer to the festivities.

Twitter

This platform has increasingly become the go-to place for action as it happens in real-time. That makes it a prime destination when searching for all things related to NFR. A quick search bar or hashtag follow will almost assuredly lead to the discovery of someone streaming the National Finals Rodeo 2023.

Reddit

Mainly known as a news aggregation site, this platform has increasingly become a well-known discussion forum hub. Within those forums, there is undoubtedly discussion concerning how to watch the 2023 NFR events.

What to do during 2023 NFR week in Las Vegas

Vegas never has a dull moment, especially during the Wrangler National Finals Rodeo held every December. Enjoy some quality family time here and wind up the year with a bang.

Here are some things to do at the NFR 2023.

Cowboy Corral – 2023

Here is where you can enjoy live performances before and after the Wrangler NFR each night. You can enjoy thrilling live entertainment at the Cowboy Corral an hour before the National Finals, including The Brit Stokes Band and Cowboy Revival. Rodeo fans will continue to enjoy the Cowboy Corral once The Brit Stokes Band returns after the NFR.

  • Dates: December 7-16
  • Time: Gates open at 4 PM.
  • Location: Cox Pavilion, next to the Thomas & Mack Center.

Rodeo Vegas at The Mirage – 2023

Bring your best western gear and tune into the best live country music entertainment at The Mirage, which showcases Rodeo Vegas 2023.

  • Dates: – December 7 – 16
  • Time: 5:45 p.m. — 12:30 a.m.
  • Location: The Mirage Race & Sports Book Free Event

Music makes a rodeo more exciting. An electric atmosphere is needed beforehand and during the event to make the Wrangler National Finals Rodeo an unforgettable event.

Here is the live music lineup for the event.

  • Thursday, December 2 & Sunday, December 5: Casey Donahew Band
  • Friday, December 3: LOCASH
  • Saturday, December. 4: Devin Dawson
  • Monday, December 6: Eli Young Band
  • December 7 – 8: Glen Templeton
  • Thursday, December 9: Mark Chesnutt
  • Friday, December 10: Ian Munsick
  • Saturday, December 11: Randy Houser

Gold Buckle Zone at MGM Grand – 2023

You can enjoy FREE live music, free viewing parties, dancing, and giveaways at night.

  • Dates: December 7 – 16
  • Time: 7:30 PM – 2 AM
  • Location: The Central at MGM Grand, near the Sports Book

Rodeo World Las Vegas at the Resorts World Las Vegas

Rodeo fans will be able to watch the Rodeo from Resorts World Las Vegas’ Dawg House, a classic Nashville sports bar sponsored by Wrangler, with daily live music and food specials.

  • Dates: December 6 – 16
  • Time: 5:45 PM – 7:45 PM
  • Location: Wrangler Dawg House at the Resorts World Las Vegas

In addition, the Dawg House Saloon will host a Pre-party starting at 11:30 AM, emceed by professional rodeo announcer Anthony Lucia, and featuring surprise appearances by famous bullfighters, rodeo clowns, and more.

Buckin’ Bash at The Orleans

Every evening, Buckin’ Bash hosts Las Vegas’ most incredible cowboy party, with live country music, two-step dancing, brews, and a rodeo celebrity guest for a toast. Justin Rumford hosts the event.

  • Dates: – December 7 – 16
  • Time: 9:00PM – 2:00 AM
  • Location: Inside the Bourbon Street Lounge at The Orleans Hotel and Casino

Everything You Need to Know About NFR

Wrangler NFR is known as the world’s wealthiest and most prestigious rodeo and takes place from Thursday, December 7 through Saturday, December 16, 2023, at the Thomas & Mack Center. Rodeo fans can enjoy multiple entertainment options before and after the Wrangler National Finals Rodeo in the arena this year. You have no excuse for not attending the 2023 NFR in Las Vegas.

Beyond the payouts for the Cowboys, the PRCA estimates that the event brings in about $90 million annually to the Las Vegas economy. Furthermore, recent attendance stats have shown that 177,565 rodeo enthusiasts decked out in Wrangler jeans, Justin boots and cowboy hats attended events at the Thomas & Mack with an additional 40,000 fans who watched at the 40 hotels that hosted watch parties. It is during this rare time of the year that many marquees on the Strip have the face of bull riders replacing DJs’ faces.

What is the National Finals Rodeo (NFR)?

We can call it the Super Bowl of all rodeos. Professional Rodeo Cowboys Association concludes its season with the National Finals Rodeo in Las Vegas. Each rodeo performance begins with a performance of the national anthem by some notable entertainers. After that, the competition commences.

How to qualify to compete in the National Finals Rodeo

PRCA World Standings for the standard rodeo events determine who qualifies for the NFR. The events include Saddle Bronc Riding, Bareback Riding, Team Roping (headers and heelers), Steer Wrestling, Tie-Down Roping, Bull Riding, and WPRA Barrel Racing. A share of the $10.257 million purses and the ultimate PRCA World Championship Gold Buckle will be on the line.

Ten rounds make up the National Finals Rodeo. Each contestant competes once a day over the course of each 10 consecutive day period.

How the National Finals Rodeo Winners are selected

In the NFR competition, two champions are crowned in each event (four in team roping). During the 10 rounds, the first champion is determined by the best average time or score. The Second Champion is the world champion who earned the most money for the year, including NFR winnings. It is important to note that each event’s average winner and world champion may be the same person or different people.

NFR Main Events

Seven main events have historically taken place at the National Finals Rodeo. Each event has its own monetary prizes that are paid out, and those payouts are determined by each top-placing competitor’s rank in relation to the event’s overall prize pool. Individuals placed in the top-six of a particular event are paid out accordingly, while individuals placed in the top-eight of the overall NFR are also paid out. The NFR main events are as follows:

Bareback Riding

This consists of a horseback cowboy using bareback rigging as the primary means of staying on top of the horse. This grip has often been compared to the equivalent of hanging on to a suitcase handle and makes for the only support that a cowboy has on top of the wildly bucking horse. An 8-second ride constitutes a qualified ride and the cowboys are judged on riding technique.

Steer Wrestling

This act involves a horseback steer wrestler, alternatively known as a “bulldogger”, bringing a fast-moving steer to a halt on its back as fast as possible. The bulldogger utilizes a combination of strength, technique, speed, and precision to jump off of their horse from a designated starting point and onto a steer sprinting off from the same starting point.

Team Roping

  • Headers

    One of two horseback team members whose job is to successfully rope the head of the steer in one of three tries as fast as possible; around both horns, around one horn and the head, or around the neck.

  • Heelers

    One of two horseback team members whose job is to successfully rope the hind legs of the steer as soon as the header has successfully done their part. To avoid a 5-second penalty for roping only one hind leg, the heeler must rope both hind legs.

Saddle Bronc Riding

Similar to Bareback Riding, the goal of the horseback cowboy is to maintain their balance as much as possible for 8 seconds while the horse is bucking. In this event, however, the cowboy sits on a saddle while using one hand to hold on to a thick rein that’s attached to the horse’s halter.

Tie-Down Roping

This event centers around a cowboy on horseback attempting to restrain a calf by throwing a well-timed rope loop that’s attached to the cowboy’s horse. The cowboy and the calf both leave from a designated starting point, with the calf getting a slight head start. The cowboy depends on the horse to mitigate any slack in the rope after dismounting, then proceeds to tie up the calf as fast as possible.

Barrel Racing

This is a women’s event where horseback cowgirls race against the clock to complete a strategically set course where barrels are set up as landmarks. The intent is for the cowgirls to complete a cloverleaf-shaped run around 3 barrels placed in a triangular formation as fast as possible. Barrels that are accidentally knocked over result in 5-second penalties.

Bull Riding

The cowboy on top of the bull has the main objective of staying on top and maintaining their balance for 8 seconds. They are judged based on technique and can earn extra points by spurring while the bull is bucking. The cowboy stays on top of the bull by grasping a flat braided rope, which also wraps around the bull’s chest.

All-Around Champion

Being crowned the All-Around Champion speaks volumes about the versatility and high level of talent exhibited by the winning cowboy.  In order to receive this honor, the cowboy must have won the most prize money in a given year and competed in at least 2 NFR events while earning at least $3,000 in each of those events. This is widely known as the highest honor bestowed by the PRCA.

Contestants

There are 120 cowboys from all over the United States that will step foot as competitors within the NFR. A full list of the contestants can be found on the event’s Contestant Roster page. The top 10 ranked competitors are as follows:

  1. Stetson Dell Wright – Milford, UT – Saddle Bronc Riding
  2. Shane Hanchey – Sulphur, LA – Tie-Down Roping
  3. Ryder Wright – Beaver, UT – Saddle Bronc Riding
  4. Sage Kimzey – Salado, TX – Bull Riding
  5. Tilden Hooper – Carthage, TX – Bareback Riding
  6. Dustin Egusquiza – Marianna, FL – Team Roping (Headers)
  7. Junior Nogueira – Presidente Prudente, Brazil – Team Roping (Heelers)
  8. Paden Bray – Stephenville, TX – Team Roping (Heelers)
  9. Tim O’Connell – Zwingle, IA – Bareback Riding
  10. Travis Graves – Jay, OK – Team Roping (Heelers)

Super Bowl of Rodeo

The NFR has consistently been referred to with this phrase because of the sheer massiveness of its popularity and money-generating power within the context of rodeo. The event is considered to be so big and consistently sold-out that the UNLV basketball team that normally uses the NFR venue during the season has to annually build its schedule in a way that keeps the team on the road for the duration of the NFR festivities.

Miss Rodeo America

This is an annual pageant that takes place as part of the general festivities of the NFR. As part of the Miss Rodeo America competition, state rodeo queen finalists from the USA compete for a chance to win $20,000 as well as other smaller prizes. The winner must also attend rodeos throughout the country and promote the rodeo throughout the subsequent year.

Young women have the opportunity to gain a lifetime of experience through the Miss Rodeo America Pageant while laying the foundation for their future endeavors at the same time. Many lifelong friendships are formed in the process, and many doors are opened for all the competitors and for the young lady selected to wear the crown.

Miss Rodeo America becomes a part of a great legacy, part of history, today, tomorrow, and for generations to come.

• Date: Sunday, November 28, 2023 – Sunday, December 5, 2023
• Location: South Point Hotel

Cowboy Christmas

For those that need a break from the constant adrenaline that comes with the NFR’s main events, the Cowboy Christmas experience allows for a welcomed change of pace. This portion of NFR centers around cowboy shopping and serves as a marketplace for hundreds of exhibitors from the United States and Canada to sell to thousands of eager buyers. Typically taking place at Ft. Worth, Las Vegas, shoppers can find anything such as customized jewelry, western wear, boots and spurs, furniture, original art, handmade crafts and pottery, etc.

Standings

The 2023 PRCA season has been extremely competitive as a lot of the top cowboys are gunning for glory. Tuf Cooper sits at the top of the all-around standings and many experts believe that he is going to win his second all-around title in a row. There will be a lot of close competitions and many of the world championships could come down to the last day. You can check the current standings here.

NFR Prize Money

The total payout for the entire event is $10 million and will remain at that amount until 2023. After that, the amount will be adjusted and remain in place for the subsequent five years. All 120 qualifying contestants receive $10,000 as part of participating. This year’s detailed payout structure can be found on the PRCA’s 2023 Wrangler NFR Payoff page.

NFR Ticket Information
INCLUDING LET: Individual Season 4pk 6pk
Balcony $76 $760 $304 $456
Plaza $105 $1,050
Gold Buckle $300 $3,000

Get your ticket here.

2022 Wrangler NFR World Champions

2022 NFR World Champions
Bareback Riding Jess Pope
Steer Wrestling Tyler Waguespack
Team Roping (Header) Kaleb Driggers
Team Roping (Heeler) Junior Nogueira
Saddle Bronc Riding Zeke Thurston
Tie-Down Roping Caleb Smidt
Barrel Racing Hailey Kinsel
Bull Riding Stetson Wright
Steer Roping Cole Patterson
Breakaway Roping Shelby Boisjoli

Last Words

All in all, the National Finals Rodeo is a landmark event and a de facto-defining period of time within any given rodeo year. For anyone who is a fan of rodeo, the main events and the surrounding festivities are must-see events and must-participate experiences if the financial means allow for it. Don’t miss a minute of the exhilarating NFR live action this year from December 7th until December 16th.
